sen.j: 殖産興業（しょくさんこうぎょう）とは、明治政府が西洋諸国に対抗し、産業、資本主義育成により国家の近代化を推進した諸政策を指す。
sen.e: Shokusan-kogyo is the policies that the Meiji government proceeded to modernize and capitalize the country by encouraging industry in order to compete with western countries.
Shokusan-kogyo is the policies in which the Meiji government accelerated modernization of the nation by encouraging industry and nurturing capitalism in order to compete with western countries.
sen.cmt: 厳密には過去形のほうが適すると思われます。Thatをin whichにしました。「modernize and capitalize the country by encouraging industry」は「産業、資本主義育成により国家の近代化を推進」と少々違ってしまうと思われましたので、proceeded～industryを書き直しました。
sen.e: Shokusan-kogyo is the policies in which the Meiji government accelerated modernization of the nation by encouraging industry and nurturing capitalism in order to compete with Western countries.

History

sen.j: 江戸時代後期、鎖国体制から開国した日本は、西洋との圧倒的な国力の差を意識する。
sen.e: Japan, opening its country to the world in the late Edo period, was conscious of the overwhelming national power of western countries.
Japan, opening its country to the world in the late Edo period, became conscious of the overwhelming national power of western countries.
sen.cmt: western countriesの冠詞について、前列と同じです。Was conscious→became consciousにしました。
sen.e: Japan, opening its country to the world in the late Edo period, became conscious of the overwhelming national power of Western countries.

sen.j: 王政復古 (日本)により成立した明治新政府は富国強兵をスローガンに、積極的に自ら産業を興こす政策を取った。
sen.e: The new Meiji government, established by the Restoration of Imperial Rule in Japan, adopted the policy to promote industry actively, under the slogan of "Fukoku-kyohei" (enriching the country and strengthening the military).

The new Meiji government, established by the Restoration of Imperial Rule in Japan, adopted a policy to promote industries actively, under the slogan of "Fukoku-kyohei" (enriching the country and strengthening the military).
sen.cmt: I think "the policy" might be "a policy" and "industry" might be "industries".
sen.e: The new Meiji government, established by the Restoration of Imperial Rule in Japan, adopted a policy to promote industries actively, under the slogan of "Fukoku-kyohei" (enriching the country and strengthening the military).

sen.j: 地租改正や秩禄処分で税制改革を行い1870年には工部省を設置、ヨーロッパからお雇い外国人を多数採用し、岩倉使節団に合わせて留学生を派遣するなど産業技術の移植に務めた。
sen.e: The government carried out the tax reform by the land-tax reform and Chitsuroku-shobun (abolition measure of hereditary stipend), established the Ministry of Industry in 1870, hired many foreigners from Europe, and imported industrial technology by sending students abroad around the same time as the Iwakura Mission went Europe.

The government carried out the tax reform by the land-tax reform and Chitsuroku-shobun (abolition measure of hereditary stipend), as well as imported industrial technology by establishing the Ministry of Industry in 1870, hireing many people from Europe, and sending students abroad concurrent with the Iwakura Mission sent to Europe.
sen.cmt: 「税制改革を行い」、「設置｣、｢採用し」、「移植」の並列で訳されていますが、｢税制改革を行い」と「移植」が並列で、｢設置｣｢採用｣｢派遣」は｢移植｣の手段ではないかと思われましたので、そのように直してみました。(｢移植」が主で、他が全て手段とも解釈できます。）foreigners from Europe→people from Europeにしました。「に合わせて」なのでaround the same time as→concurrent withにし、went→sent toにしました。
sen.e: The government carried out a tax reform through the land-tax reform and Chitsuroku-shobun (measure to abolish hereditary stipend), and imported industrial technology by establishing the Ministry of Industry in 1870, hiring many people from Europe and sending students abroad in conjunction with the Iwakura Mission that was sent to Europe.

sen.j: 1872年には官営鉄道や汽船が発足し、国内の交通網が発達した。
sen.e: The domestic transportation system were started to develop due to the establishment of the government-owned railway and steamship in 1872.
The domestic transportation system were developed due to the inauguration of the government-owned railway and steamship in 1872.
The domestic transportation system were developed due to the inauguration of the government-owned railway and steamship in 1872.

sen.j: 鉱山などの事業を行い、群馬県に富岡製糸場などの官営工場を開設した。
sen.e: Also, the government started the national undertaking such as developing mines, and they established government-owned factories including Tomioka Silk Mill in Gunma prefecture.
Also, the government undertook such workings as developing mines, and established government-owned factories including Tomioka Silk Mill in Gunma prefecture.
sen.cmt: Andの後のtheyは削除しました。Startedに該当する日本語はありませんので、Started the national undertaking such as→undertook such workings asにしました。
sen.e: Also, the government undertook such workings as developing mines, and established government-owned factories including Tomioka Silk Mill in Gunma prefecture.

sen.j: 1873年には官営事業を統括する内務省 (日本)が設立される。
sen.e: In 1873, the prewar Ministry of Home Affairs was established in order to supervise national projects.
In 1873, the prewar Ministry of Home Affairs was established in order to supervise national projects.
In 1873, the prewar Ministry of Home Affairs was established in order to supervise national projects.

sen.j: 北海道には開拓使を置き、屯田兵を派遣した。
sen.e: The government located the Development Commissioner to Hokkaido, and sent ex-legionary there.
The government located the Development Commissioner to Hokkaido, and sent ex-legionary there.
The government located the Development Commissioner to Hokkaido, and sent ex-legionary there.

sen.j: 金融では1871年に新貨条例を、1872年に国立銀行条例を布告。
sen.e: About financial system, the government proclaimed the New Currency Regulation in 1871 and the Regulation of National Bank in 1872.
About financial system, the government proclaimed the New Currency Regulation in 1871 and the Regulation of National Bank in 1872.
About financial system, the government proclaimed the New Currency Regulation in 1871 and the Regulation of National Bank in 1872.

sen.j: 1880年に軍関係を除く官営事業は三井財閥、三菱財閥など民間に払下げられ、1885年工部省は廃止。
sen.e: In 1880, national projects were sold to private companies including the Mitsui combine and the Mitsubishi combine, and the Ministry of Industry was abolished in 1885.
In 1880, national projects were sold to private companies including the Mitsui combine and the Mitsubishi combine, and the Ministry of Industry was abolished in 1885.
In 1880, national projects were sold to private companies including the Mitsui combine and the Mitsubishi combine, and the Ministry of Industry was abolished in 1885.

sen.j: 1882年には大阪貿易会社が設立されて紡績業が確立し、日清戦争、日露戦争を経て日本の産業革命が進んだ。
sen.e: In 1882, spinning industry was established for the Osaka trading company was founded, and then industrial revolution in Japan was developed after the Sino-Japanese War and the Russo-Japanese War.
In 1882 the Osaka trading company was founded to establish spinning industry and then industrial revolution in Japan was proceeded after the Sino-Japanese War and the Russo-Japanese War.
sen.cmt: spinning industry was established for→to establish spinning industryにしてfoundedの後に入れました。「進んだ」のでdeveloped→proceededにしました。
sen.e: In 1882 the Osaka trading company was founded to establish spinning industry and then industrial revolution in Japan was proceeded after the Sino-Japanese War and the Russo-Japanese War.

sen.j: 民間では岩崎弥太郎の創始した三菱や三井は政府の保護を受けて政商となった。
sen.e: In private company, Mitsubishi, which was founded by Yataro IWASAKI, and Mitsui became businessmen with political ties, protected by the government.
In private companies, Mitsubishi, which was founded by Yataro IWASAKI, and Mitsui became businessmen with political ties, under the protection of the government.
sen.cmt: companyを複数形にしました。Protected by→under the protection ofにしました。
sen.e: In private companies, Mitsubishi, which was founded by Yataro IWASAKI, and Mitsui became businessmen with political ties, under the protection of the government.

sen.j: こうした過程を通じ、財閥の形成が促されたのだった。
sen.e: Through this process, Zaibatsu (a financial combine) formed rapidly.
These process urged the formation of Zaibatsu (a financial combine).
sen.cmt: 「促され」は「form rapidly」とはニュアンスが違うと思われましたので、urgeを用いて書き直しました。
sen.e: These process urged the formation of Zaibatsu (a financial combine).
